abstracts.cdata!:
The project would provide a technical
            and economic evaluation of the Perkoa zinc-silver deposit
            and legal and promotional assistance to attract private
            foreign investors for its development. In addition, it would
            help develop and strengthen project preparation
            capabilities. The project, which would be carried out in two
            phases, would comprise: Phase I: (i) drilling and
            delineation of the Perkoa deposit and its neighboring
            anomalies, geochemical and geophysical surveys of the area
            and preparation of an ore reserve and a prefeasibility
            report; (ii) assistance for the establishment of a mineral
            dressing laboratory and development of a project preparation
            unit capable of evaluating mining deposits and for the
            control and monitoring of the evaluation program; (iii)
            comparative review of mining legislation and mining
            concession agreements, in particular for base and precious
            metals and preparation of model agreements and draft
            contractual agreements for Perkoa; and (iv) assistance for
            the promotion of the Perkoa project toward private foreign
            investment; and Phase II: (i) given positive results in
            Phase I, construction of an access ramp to the deposit,
            underground drilling to determine mining conditions and bulk
            sampling of the ore for metallurgical testing.
